column5: My fiancÃ© is 28 and Iâ€™m 20 weâ€™ve been together since I was 18 so coming up on 3 years in December. We are great together but itâ€™s gonna really depend if yâ€™all are at the same place and want the same things. My fiancÃ© and I are about 5-9 years out from having kids and we are both in college. So even though we are 8.5 year apart we are basically at the same point in our lives. We are also very lucky and have had very little judgments from family because my parents are 19/20 years apart.

I think that a lot of people tried to convince me while I was in foster care that my mother really did love me even though all of her actions showed otherwise. She constantly chose every man over my sister and I and would go as far as to say that she would call DHS have them take us away if we were acting up. I think that she feels an obligation to us and that other people would judge her if she Did not act as a mother even if in private she doesnâ€™t care the least bit about us. I feel like a lot of people think that parent and child bonding is genetic or inherent but I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s the case. I think itâ€™s a choice. My mother chose that my sister and I were too much and only worth her time when we made her look good. In my heart of hearts I donâ€™t think that she ever loved me and that hurts. I think A lot of people try to soothe that hurt by telling us that our parents love us but they just canâ€™t show us instead of saying that youâ€™re right and thatâ€™s because of them not you.I think having a parent that doesnâ€™t love you or isnâ€™t capable of loving you the right Way is one of the deepest hurts any human could ever experience. It makes me feel very sad that so many people relate to not being loved by their parents because thatâ€™s not the way it supposed to be. I often grieve for my inner child who had to experience do you abuse, uncertainty, and world wind that my childhood was.

It does make it worse. However people I think try to excuse her behavior because of her mental illness. Basically she can do no wrong or canâ€™t be held accountable for her actions even though she can drive and take care of herself and anything else or any other person who is accountable can do. I think itâ€™s utter bullshit that basically she gets off and never have to deal with any of the repercussions of her actions.

If being a single parent means abusing your children physically mentally or sexually, you shouldnâ€™t be a parent at all. It makes me so upset that people think itâ€™s OK to abuse their children because they birthed them.

Honestly it would almost be better if she died. Not because I want her to be dead but because it would be easier to explain and she wouldnâ€™t still be causing trouble in my life also my anxiety towards what the future looks like would decrease significantly.
My fiancÃ© likes to say â€œWhatâ€™s love got to do with itâ€ when someone is stuck in a toxic situation and they say that.

I completely agree with love is actions not words. Itâ€™s like just because someone says they shit gold doesnâ€™t make it true. A lot of people just have to believe that parents inherently love their offspring when thatâ€™s not true. My mom told me she loved me as many times as she told me she hated me, thought I was stupid, a b*tch, and so much more.

I understand that. My bf at the time i left my moms home told me â€œWas it even that bad?â€. Iâ€™m like sorry Iâ€™m hard to believe or something. I think people just donâ€™t want to believe that parents can be worst than an stranger could imagine.

Iâ€™m my opinion if she could just admit what she has done wrong, I could let go and maybe be civil with her. However I refuse to let someone who tries to gaslight me when I talk about my childhood traumas be apart of my life. I have very little contact and even then itâ€™s brief. I donâ€™t care to hear about her life nor do I wish to share mine with her.

My mom likes to pretend to be a great mom who still has contact with my sister and I. She constantly post about us and tags us in post. My mom actually picked it up from a counselor. I have NC most of the time other than when she is in town. Luckily she lives a solid 6 hours away and only comes once or twice a year. I think itâ€™s good advice especially when you are stuck in an abusive situation.

Thatâ€™s the exact reason why I left my mothers home at 17. It came to a point where the abuse was so bad that I would do anything to escape. And she used to tell me all the time about how if itâ€™s you or me Iâ€™m gonna pick me so I took her advice and when it was me or her I picked me. It was one of the hardest things Iâ€™ve ever had to do but my life is better for it. This is also why itâ€™s so hard when people try to tell me that she loves me because I donâ€™t think that love should be painful or almost kill you.

Thatâ€™s the thing for me. She tells me that she loves me or she misses me but then makes absolutely no effort to be a consistent or reliable person. Thatâ€™s why itâ€™s so frustrating when people try to tell me that she loves me because even if she was capable of love she has absolutely no healthy way of showing it so is it even really love.

Yes I absolutely agree, most of the people who they are saying are â€œheroesâ€ have no choice but to crawl out of bed and go to work. When I try to voice my opinion though they say â€œIâ€™m sure they just need a breakâ€ or that â€œThey are still working even from home they canâ€™t do that with their kids.â€ I think itâ€™s excuses and bullshit because YOU decide to have 3 kids that You didnâ€™t wanna deal with and would rather put your own child at risk of getting sick/getting others sick because You couldnâ€™t just keep them home during a literal pandemic. Itâ€™s much harder to leave bio parents because most authoritative people will believe parents over kids everyday of the week. Also my mom is very good at convincing people that she is the victim and just trying to rebuild herself. Just remember not everything that glitters is gold .

Just realized reunification doesnâ€™t always turn out all peachy. I was reunified with my mother after being out of her home 1.5 years. After 3 months she started fighting with and hit my sister. Then after 6 months my sister turned 18 and moved out because my mom tried to beat her up. I soon became the new scapegoat and got all of the neglect, emotional abuse, and physical abuse. I endured that for 3 years before finally leaving. I reached out for help many time through out that time. I tried to tell the cops many times but they thought I was a troubled teen and since DHS rarely communicates cross county lines I was stuck.

Restricting your foster child to only have two hours of communication with biological family and friends is awful (especially considering that fact we are in quarantine). Even if the mom isnâ€™t the best influence she doesnâ€™t seem to be a danger to her daughter and keeping her away from her mother would be catastrophic. These foster parents should not be telling the biological mother what she needs to be doing with her child. They need to be building a relationship with her and the mother needs to be working on her plan. They are not mental health professionals nor are they caseworkers.

I understand what you are talking about but isolation from mother would be so much worse at this point. My mom constantly disappoints me and my sister. Sadly she will never be a stable or constant person in my life. Iâ€™m 20 years old and my mom still has a profound impact of my emotional state when she flakes on plans or ghosts me. Itâ€™s hard to be in foster care even if you are in a safer environment. I think when you have teenagers you need to act as positive influence rather than someone who controls their life. She isnâ€™t grown but she will never learn how to think for herself and problem solve if everyone around her tells her what to do. I think empowering her to make choices in a safe place in a safe way will go a long way. Becoming resilient is so important and Iâ€™d maybe take the time to build short term and long term goals with her. Also if you are still worried about her becoming a teen mom Iâ€™d talk through what a good parent looks like, how much money she will need to care for herself and her child, and what kinds of jobs would provide the type of money and flexibility to do that. As a teen I wanted a baby so much but as I get older and realize that I want to be able to spend time with, nurture, and give my child a lot of opportunities in this world. This has been the main reason for deciding that I wonâ€™t have kids for the next 7-10 years. Children are great but imagine the life you can nurture if you are financially, physically, and  emotionally healthy. Just take this time in quarantine to build a relationship with her because end of day she needs positive influences.

I think that bigger corporations should discount because they can afford it and the government is more likely to bail them out. These bigger corporations also will probably only pay their employees for the following two weeks after closing so anything collected after that point will just be pure profit. I think that small home child care places should be able to receive unemployment but if they are not I think asking for continuing to ask for pay is understandable. In a perfect world America would already have a system set up to be able to support the people that are out of a job. Sadly a lot of Americans see this as a socialist ideal and wonâ€™t support it. My governor is currently trying to restrict unemployment to 12 weeks which will leave many homeless or in debt once this pandemic is over.

I work for a large company that owns a chain of childcare businesses and they are still collecting money from the parents whether or not they are temporarily closed. This is money to hold their spot for when we reopen. If my work place closes I will get paid for the following 2 weeks then I will have to file for unemployment. I can understand your frustration but realize if you drop and she decides to not hold your spot you canâ€™t be upset. Everyone is struggling right now and most childcare places do expect the parent to pay to hold a spot for that child. Iâ€™d just hate for you to drop out of the home childcare program then struggle to find another program with a spot for your child to attend after all of this ends.

I feel that I was always good at homework itâ€™s predictable. I use to fly through work to keep myself distracted from everything. Truth everyone would say I was the perfect child and I was just want to learn everything. When in reality I was constantly stressed out trying to figure out life struggling with my self image. I was also trying to work through my own trauma and take care of my mom when she was sad. I use to scratch my arms to try and control my emotions because I had seen my own mother cut her arms open. I luckily had many teachers who took an interest in me because of my smarts. However I couldnâ€™t deal with change so I had lots of outbursts leading to my never having friends as a child.

I use to tell people that how am I supposed to be normal when Iâ€™ve never seen what normal is. Itâ€™s a day to day struggle to try and not minimize my abuse. Itâ€™s hard because no one wants to think that their life was bad or something to be a ashamed of. I sometimes think how can I get to be how they are naturally because I canâ€™t just go with the flow or just let go. I have always been the one to think it through and I have to make sure that Iâ€™m safe and have a plan if things so south.

Truth and I canâ€™t stand that she can still have this much control over me. Itâ€™s very frustrating to feel like you canâ€™t control yourself or your feelings. I know that I shouldnâ€™t beat myself up so much but itâ€™s easier to be mad at myself then at her. Thatâ€™s because I know she will never Change and being mad at her seems useless.

I feel like itâ€™s easier to validate the physical abuse Iâ€™ve been through rather than the emotional abuse. Thatâ€™s hard because emotional abuse can be very apparent to completely hidden. My mom was very good at making everyone else seem like the bad guy so sometimes she even convinced me that I deserved it. Itâ€™s like the time I didnt seem to appreciate a gift enough so she lectured me for hours . Then when I finally throws to leave she somehow got me on the ground and was sitting on my chest. I felt like I couldnâ€™t breathe and I just kept ask/telling her to get off I canâ€™t breathe. And then sheâ€™s say â€œif you can talk you can breatheâ€ and I was still in my head after beating myself up because â€œI should have acted more excited and happyâ€ I feel like if I accept how bad it was then it will take over everything.

Itâ€™s kinda like if you are just being dramatic then itâ€™s not so sad. Sometimes I feel myself grieving for being the way I am. I sometimes get so overwhelmed by things other people let roll off there back that it becomes very frustrating to be me. It also doesnâ€™t help that everyone expects me to be normal and I just canâ€™t handle it. Then when I finally lose it I feel like such a POS and just incredibly Emotionally unstable. Then that feeling makes me feel worst because I keep thinking I should be able to do this. Itâ€™s honestly a very bad cycle of feelings.

Bump all that stuff about forgiving those people. I donâ€™t have to forgive nothing and Iâ€™m certainly never involving myself with them again. People have this belief that forgiveness makes everything okay and will make you feel so much better. However most abusive people wonâ€™t even recognize why they need forgiveness and also will use that as a way to try and make you let them in your life again.

Yes the statistics are really against us breaking out the the cycle. Iâ€™m constantly doubting whether Iâ€™m being to passive or if Iâ€™m being to aggressive with my behavior management tactics. Iâ€™m so worried about just messing everything up around me because itâ€™s the first time Iâ€™ve been around any good enough people.

I donâ€™t even have to try hard to see why my mom and dad were the way they were or my grandparents. My mother suffered sexual, emotional and physical abuse.
